MSB HEADQUABTEES
January 13, 1953
TO* Eugene Foster, Syracuse; Harry Lamb, Toledo; Kay Lardie, Detroit; Paul
Rickard, Detroit; John Henderson, Lafayette; Frank Schooled Hrbana;
George Jennings, Chicago; Richard Hull, Asses; Carl Manzer, leva City;
Marguerite Fleming, St, Louis; H. E. Salley, Louisville; Robert Wallace,
Oxford; I* Keith Tyler, (kxhmbus; B. Kendall Crane, Pittsburgh; Martha
Gable, Philadelphia; Mrs, Ludwig, Institute of International Education.
FROM* Jim *files, Executive Director
Because of other commitments, Mr. Nizami can only visit with MEB stations
for six weeks. I have, therefore, re-drawn the schedule. It is my firm
that this will be the final draft of it. This re-draft will necessi¬
tate seme changes. However, I have only eliminated two spots from the
previous schedule — namely, Cleveland and Madison.
I am reliably informed that Mr. Nizami is a very high level personage in
his own country. He speaks English fluently. He is very dark skinned.
Hence, where color barriers are a problem, due caution should be observed.
The travel schedule for Mr. Nizami will bo mad© by the Institute of
International Education. They will inform each of you as to his exact
arrival time in your city. He will also have your name and address with
phone number. Arrangements have been made for him to travel during the
daytime hours and, bonce, he should arrive in each location at a fairly
reasonable hour. Anywhere that it is possible, X would suggest that yon
attempt to meet him in front of the information or ticket window at the
local station.
Each person is responsible for arranging for accommodations for Mr. Nizami,
on the nights ho is in your car©. Mr. Nizami does have travel funds to pay
for these acccamodations.
I trust that each of you will give him a #25 tour of your operation and that
you will discuss matters of international, exchange of programs and ideas on
a two-way basis with him.
If for any reason the revised schedule is not agreeable to you, I trust you
will communicate with me at once so that we can make further modifications.
